alert.note: Alert for Bergen (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 30 at 10:02PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Jersey, including the following county, Bergen. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1000 PM EDT, The Hohokus Brook remains in minor flood stage. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas is expected. Additional rainfall tonight will likely keep the Hohokus Brook in minor flooding for several hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ho-Ho-Kus. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
